Posts.Content: Just happened to click on this thread and read with interest. I went through chemotherapy and radiotherapy for lower bowel cancer. I was fortunate that hair loss was a rare side effect of the chemo I received and all I suffered was a slight thinning. The pelvic radiotherapy however has left me completely bald down below with no hope of it returning. I keep telling myself it's a small price to pay for survival, but I am devastated by it, along with the infertility. There is a massive difference between doing something by choice and having no choice. Perhaps Macmillan could do a "Brave the pubic hair Shave" campaign, but I suspect there wouldn't be much interest as nobody would be able to see what was going on underneath their clothes thus no pats on the back for being so "brave."
Posts.Title: Does anyone else dislike the Macmillan Brave the Shave campaign?
